summary: This is an internal FBI email chain discussing the creation of a public victim questionnaire and webpage for the Epstein case. It outlines technical and content requirements for soliciting information from potential victims to aid the investigation.

persons.name: Angela
persons.context: Addressed in an email from an FBI colleague regarding the creation of a victim questionnaire for the Epstein case.

events.title: FBI Plans Victim Questionnaire for Epstein Case
events.description: Internal FBI correspondence outlines plans to create a public-facing victim questionnaire and informational webpage to gather information from potential victims of Jeffrey Epstein.

keyFacts: The FBI's Victim Services Division was actively planning to solicit information from potential victims of Jeffrey Epstein in July 2019.
Plans included creating a dedicated public email address and webpage to explain the case and encourage victims to come forward.
The questionnaire was designed to collect basic victim information to help agents prioritize interviews, not to replace them.
